## waitForVisible() function

Wait for an element matched by a CSS query selector to become visible. Visible means the element has neither `display:none` nor `visibility:hidden`<!-- -->. Elements outside the current viewport (e.g. you'd need to scroll) and hidden with CSS trickery (opacity, overlaid with z-index, or permanently positioned outside the viewport) count as visible.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function waitForVisible(page: Page, selector: string, { message, timeout }?: TimeoutOptions): Promise<ElementHandle>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  page | Page | puppeteer page object. |
|  selector | string | Query selector, e.g. <code>div &gt; a[href=&quot;/&quot;]:visited</code> |
|  { message, timeout } | [TimeoutOptions](./pentf.timeoutoptions.md) |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;ElementHandle&gt;

A handle to the found element.
